result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court.   
Defendant Terrell A Viverette did not appear - out ill.

Defense is requesting substitution of judge - Court will grant as being timely - Arraignment has not happened yet.
Once the Substitution has been processed - Matter will need to be scheduled for Arraignment.
Arraignment on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:32 AM Defendant Terrell A Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Officer Steven Cizinsky sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Wittchow.  Cross examination by Attorney Kovac.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Kovac objects to bind over with argument.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Attorney Kovac is asking for an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  Arraignment scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:42 AM Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court.   Defendant Terrell A Viverette did not appear.   Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Kovac states his client thought the prelim was going to be by Zoom and requests an adjournment.
The State does not object.
Preliminary time limits previously waived.
The Court will adjourn.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Returned original warrant from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department for Terrell A. Viverett issued on 02-02-2022 by Judge J. Arthur Melvin, III.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

01:33 PM Defendant Terrell A Viverette in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.

Attorney Kovac makes an oral motion to dismiss the complaint and presents arguments.
The State presents counter arguments and requests the Court deny the motion.
The Court places its findings on the record.
The Court denies the Defense's Oral Motion to Dismiss.

Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
